resources.string: Deflope made from palaba with kacius seeds

"1. In a large bowl, mix cottage cheese, eggs, sugar, vanilla extract (if using), and a pinch of salt. Mix well until smooth.
" + "2. Gradually add wheat flour, continuing to mix, until the dough becomes thick and holds its shape.
" + "3. Heat a frying pan with sunflower oil over medium heat.
" + "4. Form small balls from the cottage cheese dough and slightly flatten them to resemble syrniki.
" + "5. Roll each syrnik in a small amount of flour to prevent sticking to the pan and give the syrniki a tasty crust.
" + "6. Place the syrniki on the heated frying pan and fry them for 2-3 minutes on each side until they become golden brown and cooked through.
" + "7. After frying, place the cooked syrniki on a paper towel to remove excess oil.
" + "8. Serve the syrniki hot, sprinkled with powdered sugar and with fresh fruits, berries, or jam as desired."

"• 500 g cottage cheese (can use low-fat or medium-fat)
" + "• 2 eggs
" + "• 4 tablespoons sugar
" + "• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract (optional)
" + "• 3-4 tablespoons wheat flour
" + "• Pinch of salt
" + "• Sunflower oil for frying"

"• 1 large egg
" + "• 1 cup (about 200 ml) milk
" + "• 1 cup (about 120-150 g) flour
" + "• 2 tablespoons sugar
" + "• 1 teaspoon baking powder
" + "• Pinch of salt
" + "• Sunflower oil for frying
" + "• Optional additional ingredients: berries, sliced fruits, raisins, nuts, etc."

"1. In a bowl, beat the egg with a fork or mixer until homogeneous.
" + "2. Add milk and beat until well combined.
" + "3. Gradually add flour, continuing to beat to avoid lumps.
" + "4. Add sugar, baking powder, and a pinch of salt. Beat the batter until smooth and homogeneous.
" + "5. Let the batter rest for 10-15 minutes to allow the flour to slightly swell.
" + "6. Heat a frying pan over medium heat and add a little sunflower oil.
" + "7. Pour a small amount of batter onto the pan to form pancakes of desired size (usually about 1/4 cup of batter per pancake).
" + "8. Fry the pancakes on one side until bubbles appear on the surface and the bottom is golden brown, then flip them and fry on the other side.
" + "9. Repeat the process with the remaining batter, adding sunflower oil to the pan as needed.
" + "10. After frying, place the pancakes on a paper towel to remove excess oil.
" + "11. Serve the pancakes hot with honey, syrup, fresh berries, fruits, or powdered sugar as desired."

"1. Prepare the palapa by peeling it and slicing it into thin slices.
" + "2. In a deep bowl, beat eggs with a fork. Add milk, flour, sugar, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt. Mix well until the batter is smooth without lumps.
" + "3. Coat the slices of palapa in the batter to evenly cover them.
" + "4. Heat a frying pan with sunflower oil over medium heat.
" + "5. Fry the battered slices of palapa on both sides until golden brown and cooked through.
" + "6. Once the palapa slices are ready, transfer them to a plate.
" + "7. Sprinkle the cooked deflope with cashew seeds on top for added texture and flavor.
" + "8. Serve the palapa deflope with cashew seeds hot as a main dish or dessert, sprinkled with powdered sugar and with fresh fruits or berries as desired."

"• 500 g palapa
" + "• 100 g cashew seeds
" + "• 2 eggs
" + "• 100 ml milk
" + "• 50 g flour
" + "• 50 g sugar
" + "• 1 tsp vanilla extract
" + "• Pinch of salt
" + "• Sunflower oil for frying"

"1. Cut the beef into medium-sized pieces. Put the meat in a large pot and cover with cold water so that the meat is completely submerged. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer until the meat is tender (usually about 1-1.5 hours). Skim off any foam that forms on the surface of the pot. 
" "
" "2. While the meat is cooking, prepare the vegetables. Peel and chop the beets, potatoes, onion, and carrots. Also, chop the cabbage and finely chop the garlic.
" "3. When the meat is almost done, add the chopped beets and potatoes to the pot. Cook until the vegetables are tender.
" "4. In a separate skillet, sauté the chopped onion and carrots until soft and golden brown. Add the tomato paste and sauté for a few more minutes.
" "5. Add the sautéed onion and carrots to the pot with the broth and vegetables. Also, add the chopped cabbage and garlic.
" "6. Continue to simmer the borscht over medium heat for another 10-15 minutes to allow all the flavors to combine.
" "7. Then add salt, pepper, and vinegar to taste. Adjust the amount of vinegar according to your preference.
" "8. Serve the borscht hot, garnished with sour cream and fresh herbs if desired. Borscht is usually served with black bread or dumplings.
"

"• 500g beef
" "• 2-3 large beets
" "• 2-3 medium potatoes
" "• 1 large onion
" "• 1-2 carrots
" "• 1/4 cabbage
" "• 2-3 cloves of garlic
" "• 2-3 tablespoons of tomato paste
" "• 2-3 bay leaves
" "• Salt and pepper to taste
" "• Vinegar to taste
" "• Sour cream and herbs for serving"
